intro: Chavica labillardierei, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in spring. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. Chavica labillardierei is a perennial herb that is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens with well-draining soil.
